question: 不足
sourceMnemonic:
You have something that's <kanji>not</kanji> <kanji>sufficient</kanji>. When something isn't sufficient, you have an <vocabulary>insufficiency</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>shortage</vocabulary>.

This word is more commonly used in formal contexts. In more casual, everyday conversations, <ja>足りない</ja> is often preferred to express something being insufficient.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
